  • Method Details

    • triggerNextState

      public void triggerNextState()

    • placeTile

      public void placeTile(Player player, int x, int y) throws InvalidStateException
      Places a tile at the specified coordinates for the given player. Throws an exception if the player is not in the correct state to place a tile. See the relative action for more exceptions and context
      Overrides:
      placeTile in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to place the tile.
      x - The x-coordinate where the tile is placed.
      y - The y-coordinate where the tile is placed.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the player is not in the BUILDING state.

    • setShip

      public void setShip(Player player, int x, int y) throws InvalidStateException
      This action is triggered when cheats are used, in order to build a ship faster.
      Overrides:
      setShip in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to place the tile.
      x - The x-coordinate where the tile is placed.
      y - The y-coordinate where the tile is placed.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the player is not in the BUILDING state.

    • rotateTile

      public void rotateTile(Player player, String type) throws InvalidStateException
      Rotates the tile held by the specified player in the given direction. The rotation can be to the left, right, or down, as specified by the type. Throws an exception if the player is not in the correct state to perform the rotation. See the relative action for more exceptions and context
      Overrides:
      rotateTile in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player holding the tile to be rotated.
      type - The direction of rotation ("LEFT", "RIGHT", or "DOWN").
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the player is not in the BUILDING state.

    • placeInBuffer

      public void placeInBuffer(Player player) throws InvalidStateException
      Allows the specified player to place a tile in the buffer if conditions are met. The player must be in the BUILDING state, and the game level must be 2. Throws an exception if these conditions are not satisfied. See the relative action for more exceptions and context
      Overrides:
      placeInBuffer in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to place a tile in the buffer.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the player is not in the BUILDING state or if the game level is not 2.

    • chooseTile

      public void chooseTile(Player player, int tileID) throws InvalidStateException
      Allows the specified player to choose a tile from the list of face-up tiles. The player must be in the correct state to perform this action. See the relative action for more exceptions and context
      Overrides:
      chooseTile in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to choose a tile.
      tileID - The ID of the tile the player intends to choose from the face-up tiles.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the player is not in the BUILDING or SHOWING_FACE_UP state.

    • chooseTileFromBuffer

      public void chooseTileFromBuffer(Player player, int idx) throws InvalidStateException
      Allows the specified player to choose a tile from their buffer. The player must be in the BUILDING state to perform this action. See the relative action for more exceptions and context
      Overrides:
      chooseTileFromBuffer in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is attempting to choose a tile from their buffer.
      idx - The index of the tile in the buffer that the player wants to pick.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the player is not in the BUILDING state.

    • showFaceUp

      public void showFaceUp(Player player) throws InvalidStateException
      Allows the specified player to view the face-up tiles available during their turn. The player must be in the BUILDING state to perform this action; otherwise, an exception is thrown. The method changes the player's state to SHOWING_FACE_UP and prints the list of face-up tiles to the console. See the relative action for more exceptions and context
      Overrides:
      showFaceUp in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to view the face-up tiles.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the player is not in the BUILDING state.

    • closeFaceUpTiles

      public void closeFaceUpTiles(Player player) throws InvalidStateException
      Closes the face-up tiles for the specified player. This action is only allowed if the player is in the SHOWING_FACE_UP state. If the player is not in the correct state, an InvalidStateException is thrown. See the relative action for more exceptions and context
      Overrides:
      closeFaceUpTiles in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to close the face-up tiles.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the player is not in the SHOWING_FACE_UP state.

    • drawFaceDown

      public void drawFaceDown(Player player) throws InvalidStateException
      Allows the specified player to draw a face-down tile during the BUILDING phase. This action is only permitted when the player is in the BUILDING state. If the player is not in the correct state, an InvalidStateException is thrown. See the relative action for more exceptions and context
      Overrides:
      drawFaceDown in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to draw a face-down tile.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the player is not in the BUILDING state.

    • returnTile

      public void returnTile(Player player) throws InvalidStateException
      Allows the specified player to return a held tile during the BUILDING phase. This action is only permitted if the player is in the BUILDING state. If the player attempts to return a tile while in an invalid state, an exception is thrown. See the relative action for more exceptions and context
      Overrides:
      returnTile in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is attempting to return their held tile.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the player is not in the BUILDING state.

    • pickPile

      public void pickPile(Player player, int pileIndex) throws InvalidStateException
      Allows the specified player to pick a pile during their turn in the BUILDING phase. The player must be in the BUILDING state to perform this action. If the pile is already being viewed by another player, or the player is not in the correct state, an InvalidStateException is thrown. See the relative action for more exceptions and context
      Overrides:
      pickPile in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to pick the pile.
      pileIndex - The index of the pile the player wants to pick.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the player is not in the BUILDING state or the pile is already being viewed by another player.

    • returnPile

      public void returnPile(Player player) throws InvalidStateException
      Allows the specified player to return a pile they were viewing during their turn. This action is only permitted if the player is in the SHOWING_PILE state. If the player is not in the correct state, an InvalidStateException is thrown. See the relative action for more exceptions and context
      Overrides:
      returnPile in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to return the pile.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the player is not in the SHOWING_PILE state.

    • endBuilding

      public void endBuilding(Player player, int position) throws InvalidStateException
      Ends the building phase for a player by allowing them to select a starting position if all preconditions are met. This method checks the player's current state and validates the chosen position. If the player's state or position is invalid, an exception is thrown. If all players have completed the building phase, it triggers the next game state. See the relative action for more exceptions and context
      Overrides:
      endBuilding in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to end the building phase.
      position - The starting position the player chooses.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the player is not in a valid state to end the building phase, if the position is invalid, or if the position is already taken.

    • fixShip

      public void fixShip(Player player, List<Coordinates> coordinatesList) throws InvalidStateException
      Fixes the ship of the specified player by breaking the tiles at the given coordinates. Updates the player's state to READY if the ship becomes legal after fixing. If all players are READY, the next game state is triggered. See the relative action for more exceptions and context
      Overrides:
      fixShip in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is attempting to fix their ship.
      coordinatesList - The list of coordinates for the tiles to be broken on the ship.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the player is not in the FIXING state.

    • startTimer

      public void startTimer(Player player) throws InvalidStateException
      Starts the game timer for the specified player if the conditions are met. The timer can only be started if the player is not in the BUILDING state and the game is at level 2. If these conditions are not satisfied, an InvalidStateException is thrown. See the relative action for more exceptions and context
      Overrides:
      startTimer in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to start the timer.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - If the player is in the BUILDING state or if the game level is not 2.

    • stopBuilding

      public void stopBuilding(Player player) throws InvalidStateException
      Stops the building phase for all the players in the game. This method ensures that all players who are not in the READY or FIXING states are transitioned into an appropriate state based on the validity of their ships, and assigns them a starting position on the game board.
      Overrides:
      stopBuilding in class GameState
      Parameters:
      player - The player for whom the building phase is being stopped.
      Throws:
      InvalidStateException - if the current level of the game is not level 2.

    • updateView

      public void updateView(View view, Game toDisplay) throws IOException
      Updates the given view with the current state of the provided game object.
      Overrides:
      updateView in class GameState
      Parameters:
      view - the view instance that should be updated
      toDisplay - the game object containing the state to render on the view
      Throws:
      IOException - if an input or output exception occurs during the view update

    • updateStateController

      public void updateStateController(ViewController controller, Game game)
      Overrides:
      updateStateController in class GameState

    • getPlayerState

      public Map<String,BuildPlayerState> getPlayerState()
      Retrieves the current state of all players.
      Returns:
      a map where the key is a string representing the player's identifier and the value is the corresponding BuildPlayerState.

    • getIsLookingPile

      public Map<String,Integer> getIsLookingPile()
      Retrieves the map representing the "is looking pile".
      Returns:
      a map where the keys are strings representing item identifiers and the values are integers representing their corresponding counts.
